Html:
Has anyone links to a tutorial/doco on getting starting and using DDD for doing some basic graphs?     I didn't see any doco such as this so far?  (perhaps I've overlooked it somewhere?)

By the way - Is DDD a good choice for doing some graphs is a WPF application?  I was trying the WPF Toolkit at "http://wpf.codeplex.com/releases/view/29117" which didn't seem too bad, however they haven't really got the doco out yet for charting/graphing so it's a bit slow going trying to work things out.

The Dynamic Data Display is a very impressive piece of code but as many newbies, including me, have mentioned it is lacking "regular" documentation.

The best article I have found was in MSDN magazine and you can read it at:

﻿﻿﻿http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/ff714591.aspx

The other thing you need to do is download the sources to get the source code for the samples and of course download the documentation - although to be honest the documentation is really a token effort and I didn't find it all that helpful.

I hope the above doesn't sound like a complaint - D3 is a great resource - and has saved me so much time and I really appreciate the work people have put into it

Thank you very much for the reference to the MSDN article - I did not know about it.

David Roh
